intro: Calamus anomalus, commonly known as the rare or uncommon arrowroot, is a member of the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its tall, slender stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in inflorescences, which are typically borne on the upper part of the stem. Calamus anomalus is native to Southeast Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
